Learn Node Part 12: React More

Saturday, February 14, 2015

Overview

If you haven’t already, look at how to initialize React here. You can find more information here.

React works with reusable components. They are similar to AngularJS directives in a way. We’re going to be creating a person list.

 1 // ### in first.jsx ###
 2 
 3 /** @jsx React.DOM */
 4 "use strict";
 5 
 6 var data = [
 7   {first:"Vush", last: "Ky"},
 8   {first:"Dai", last: "Sy"},
 9   {first:"Ja", last: "Ky"}
10 ];
11 
12 var Person = React.createClass({
13   render: function(){
14     return (
15       <div>
16         <h2>{this.props.last}, {this.props.first}</h2>
17       </div>
18     )
19   }
20 });// End Person
21 
22 
23 var PersonList = React.createClass({
24   render: function(){
25     var people = this.props.data.map(function(person){
26       return <Person first={person.first} last={person.last} />
27     });// End People
28 
29     return (
30       <div>
31         {people}
32       </div>
33     );
34   }
35 });// End PersonList
36 
37 
38 var PersonApp = React.createClass({
39   render: function(){
40     return (
41       <div>
42         <h1>This is the person App</h1>
43         <PersonList data={this.props.data} />
44       </div>
45     );
46   }
47 });// End PersonApp
48 
49 
50 React.renderComponent(<PersonApp data={data} />, document.getElementById('first'));

We created a PersonApp which has data. The PersonApp then creates a PersonList which displays a Person for every object in the data array. React uses this.props to access attributes on the component (like first, last and data). Lets remove data because it’s static.

 1 // ### in first.jsx ###
 2 
 3 // first remove the data array.
 4 // Person doesn't change
 5 // PersonList doesn't change
 6 
 7 
 8 var PersonApp = React.createClass({
 9   getInitialState: function(){
10     return { data: [], first:"", last:"" };
11   },
12 
13   render: function(){
14     return (
15       <div>
16         <h1>This is the person App</h1>
17         <form>
18           <input type="text" value={this.state.first} />
19           <input type="text" value={this.state.last} />
20           <button type="submit">Add</button>
21         </form>
22 
23         <PersonList data={this.state.data} />
24       </div>
25     );
26   }
27 });// End PersonApp
28 
29 // notice we removed data on this line
30 React.renderComponent(<PersonApp />, document.getElementById('first'));

It looks good but it would be nice to change the state of first and last when their associated input changes.

 1 // ### in first.jsx ###
 2 
 3 var PersonApp = React.createClass({
 4   getInitialState: function(){
 5     return { data: [], first:"", last:"" };
 6   },
 7   onChangeFirst: function(e){
 8     this.setState({first: e.target.value});
 9   },
10   onChangeLast: function(e){
11     this.setState({last: e.target.value});
12   },
13 
14   render: function(){
15     return (
16       <div>
17         <h1>This is the person App</h1>
18         <form>
19           <input type="text" value={this.state.first} onChange={this.onChangeFirst} />
20           <input type="text" value={this.state.last} onChange={this.onChangeLast} />
21         </form>
22 
23         <PersonList data={this.state.data} />
24       </div>
25     );
26   }
27 });// End PersonApp

The state changes but we’re not modifying the data array inside the state. We want to add the new person object to the array. We’re going to accomplish this by adding an onSubmit event and handler to PersonApp.

 1 // ### in first.jsx ###
 2 
 3 var PersonApp = React.createClass({
 4   getInitialState: function(){
 5     return { data: [], first:"", last:"" };
 6   },
 7   onChangeFirst: function(e){
 8     this.setState({first: e.target.value});
 9   },
10   onChangeLast: function(e){
11     this.setState({last: e.target.value});
12   },
13   handleSubmit: function(e){
14     e.preventDefault();
15     this.state.data.push({ first:this.state.first, last:this.state.last});
16     this.setState({first:'', last:''});
17   },
18 
19   render: function(){
20     return (
21       <div>
22         <h1>This is the person App</h1>
23         <form onSubmit={this.handleSubmit}>
24           <input type="text" value={this.state.first} onChange={this.onChangeFirst} />
25           <input type="text" value={this.state.last} onChange={this.onChangeLast} />
26           <button type="submit">Add</button>
27         </form>
28 
29         <PersonList data={this.state.data} />
30       </div>
31     );
32   }
33 });// End PersonApp
